creditline: Gift of Dr. Gabriel P. and Yvonne M.L. Weisberg
description: round design for a small dinner plate; dark blue around edge with freely-painted flowers predominately in yellow and red
provenance: [Galerie Fischer-Kiener, Paris, until 1970s; sold to Weisbergs]; Yvonne and Gabriel Weisberg, Minneapolis (1970s–2017; given to Mia)
text: Albert Dammouse was a prolific French decorator of ceramics, primarily active at Sèvres. He made watercolors, such as this design for a plate, so that other skilled craftspeople would have a guide for application of glazes to the wares. This design appears to be part of a series for a lavish floral dinner service.
title: Design for a Plate
